Popular Name: aka The UrbanArts Institute at the Massachusetts
Category: Learning in the Arts for Children & Youth
Project Description: To support Urbano Project, a college-level arts program for teens who are guided by professional artists to create work that will be presented to the public at an annual series of spoken word performances and open mic nights, film screenings, and exhibitions. Students meet for at least three hours each week to study the history and practice of visual art, film, spoken word poetry, or graphic design, and to prepare an exhibition or performance.

Popular Name: aka The UrbanArts Institute at the Massachusetts
Category: Learning in the Arts for Children & Youth
Project Description: To support the URBANO Project, the Teen Curatorial Program and Artists' Workshops. The UrbanArts Institute at Massachusetts College of Art and Design will partner with the URBANO Project to support these two projects that were formerly supported and housed by the Cloud Foundation at Cloud Place.

Purpose: To support the creation and presentation of a new collaborative dance production. Additional Project Description: The production will be created collaboratively among dancers, musicians, and production technicians. Premiering at The Strand Theater, the show will be based on a collection of anti-bullying essays written by local sixth graders. The show will be followed by a guided discussion led by a trained instructor. Intended Beneficiaries: Program will serve residents and primarily BIPOC (Black, Indigenous, and People of Color) students in Boston. Intended Outcome: Beneficiaries engage with the arts.

Organization Name: Wang Center for the Performing Arts Inc.
Project Description: Purpose: To support youth stipends for an arts-based work-study program at the Boch Center. Additional Project Description: Aligned with the City of Boston's youth job creation initiative, the program will help teens from underserved communities develop artistic, leadership, and job readiness skills through the performing arts. The year-round, audition-based program will include a summer program. In addition to paid employment, selected teens will participate in acting, dance, or music workshops led by professional artists. They also will write a resume, participate in mock interviews, and attend workshops with guest speakers. A staff advisor will mentor each participant. Intended Beneficiaries: The program will benefit high school students from low-income communities with limited access to the arts. Intended Outcome: Beneficiaries acquire knowledge and skills in the arts.

Organization Name: Wang Center for the Performing Arts Inc.
Project Description: Purpose: To support youth stipends for an arts-based work-study program at the Boch Center. Additional Project Description: Aligned with the City of Boston's youth job creation initiative, the program helps teens from underserved communities develop artistic, leadership, and job readiness skills through the performing arts. The year-round, audition-based program includes an intensive summer program. In addition to paid employment, selected teens will participate in acting, dance, or music workshops led by professional artists. They also will write a resume, participate in mock interviews, and attend workshops with guest speakers. A staff advisor will mentor each participant. Intended Beneficiaries: The program will benefit high school age youth from low-income communities with limited access to the arts. Intended Outcomes: Beneficiaries acquire knowledge and skills in the arts.

Organization Name: Wang Center for the Performing Arts Inc.
Project Description: To support teaching artist fees and youth stipends for an arts-based work-study program at the Boch Center. Aligned with the City of Boston's youth job creation initiative, the program helps teens from underserved communities develop artistic, leadership, and job readiness skills through the performing arts. The year-round, audition-based program includes an intensive summer program. In addition to paid employment, selected teens will participate in acting, dance, or music workshops led by professional artists. They also will write a resume, participate in mock interviews, and attend workshops with guest speakers. A staff advisor will mentor each participant. Project activities will take place in-person and virtually as necessary.

Organization Name: Wang Center for the Performing Arts Inc.
Project Description: To support teaching the Boch Center's City Spotlights Teen Leadership Program, an arts-based work-study program. Aligned with the City of Boston's youth job creation initiative, the program helps teens from underserved communities develop artistic, leadership, and job readiness skills through the performing arts. The year-round, audition-based program includes a summer intensive program, which will be conducted virtually. In addition to paid employment, selected teens will participate in acting, dance, or music workshops led by professional artists. A staff advisor mentors each participant. School year activities may also be conducted virtually.

Organization Name: Wang Center for the Performing Arts Inc.
Project Description: To support the Boch Center's City Spotlights Teen Leadership Program, an arts-based work-study program. Aligned with the City of Boston's youth job creation initiative, the program is designed to help teens from underserved communities develop artistic, leadership, and job readiness skills through the performing arts. The year round, audition-based program includes a summer intensive. In addition to their paid employment, selected teens participate in acting, dance, or music workshops led by professional artists. Peer networking and presentations of students' original work take place on college campuses and other public venues in the city. Each participant is mentored by a staff advisor.

Organization Name: Wang Center for the Performing Arts Inc.
Project Description: To support ArtWeek Boston and related activities. Multidisciplinary events will take place in Boston and nearby locales in eastern Massachusetts. Working with a network of community and artistic partners, the festival will provide neighborhood-based experiences in dance, folk and traditional arts, media arts, spoken-word, poetry, writing, contemporary visual arts, music, opera, theater, design, and film.

Organization Name: Wang Center for the Performing Arts Inc.
Project Description: To support free, outdoor productions of Shakespeare's plays by the Commonwealth Shakespeare Company. The project will feature free, outdoor performances presented on Boston Common of "Taming of the Shrew," and an urban neighborhood touring production of "The Comedy of Errors" performed by the CSC Apprentice Company.

Organization Name: Wang Center for the Performing Arts Inc.
Project Description: To support a consortium project that will bring a professional Shakespeare production to public parks in Greater Boston. The Wang Center's "Tour of the Parks" will feature Commonwealth Shakespeare Company's production of "A Midsummer Night's Dream."

Organization Name: Wang Center for the Performing Arts Inc.
Project Description: To support ACT III of Arts Can Teach (ACT), a consortium project. ACT is a multi-year collaborative effort among the Wang Center, LynnArts, and the Lynn Public Schools to integrate the arts into the Lynn Public Schools' curriculum.
In recognition of Wheelock Family Theatre's outstanding "PAH! Deaf Youth Theatre" program for children and youth.
To support subsidized work space for emerging writers in Boston. The project will provide 20 authors with quiet work space 24 hours a day.
To support subsidized work space for emerging writers in Boston. The project will provide 40 authors with work space 24 hours a day.
To support subsidized work space for emerging writers using The Writers' Room of Boston. For $175 each per quarter year, The Writers Room of Boston provides 40 authors with work space 24 hours a day.

Purpose: To support teaching artist fees for a literacy and music program for preschool-age children. Additional Project Description: Teaching artists will lead 30-minute literacy-through-music lessons. Students will develop language skills through activities such as rhyming, alliteration, syllable clapping, counting songs, and finger-plays. The students’ caregivers will receive monthly newsletters that will include lessons they can complete with the children at home. Intended Beneficiaries: The project will benefit children and families from low-income areas of Greater Boston. Intended Outcome: Beneficiaries acquire knowledge and skills in the arts.

To support the augmentation of "The Fund for Young Audiences," an endowment. Earnings from this endowment will support continuing programs and will stabilize the organization as it expands operations as articulated in its current strategic plan.

To support Youth Design: Engage for a Change campaign. The campaign includes the creation of a mobile pop-up exhibit that showcases winning designs from the "Time to Design Competition" and an online broadcast of the "Professional Development Seminar Series" that profiles career paths for young designers.

Purpose: To support a music instruction, performance, and creative technology program. Additional Project Description: The year round, self-guided instrument tracks learning model in music education and creative technologies will serve youth ages 8-18 from underserved neighborhoods. The program is offered free or at low cost to students. As many as 40 direct learning programs are also offered in Spanish and include songwriting and performance, instrumental music, creative media, and creative technology. Youth will be allowed to chart their own paths by exploring new areas, or by re-enrolling in programs to develop expertise through advanced projects and skill-building, which are expected to support their overall academic success and career readiness. Intended Beneficiaries: The project will serve nearly youth, mostly from East Boston. Intended Outcome: Beneficiaries acquire knowledge and skills in the arts.

To support a music and media arts education program for youth in East Boston. The program will consist of creative youth development programs that will have a positive effect on local neighborhoods. Program activities will include writing exercises, field trips, studio recording sessions, one-on-one mentoring, rehearsing, performing, team building, and personal and group evaluations. ZUMIX believes that arts and cultural opportunities are a fundamental aspect to creative youth development and are means to building community.

Category: National Arts and Humanities Youth Program Awards
Project Description: In recognition of HANDS ON, a program which uses music to make strong positive changes in the lives of low-income, underserved youth.
